title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2101.1 - Federal family education loan program
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2101.1 - Federal family education loan program

State Regulations

The corporation has executed an agreement with the United

States Department of Education (ED) such that the corporation has been
designated by ED as the guarantee agency with the authority to administer the

Federal Family Education Loan (FFEL) Program in New York State. Pursuant to
this agreement the corporation has the authority to adopt policies and
procedures in furtherance of its responsibility to administer the FFEL Program
in New York State. In addition, pursuant to this authority, the corporation has
the power to: (a) investigate the
activities of any student, school, lender, or other institution participating
in the FFEL Program as administered by the corporation; (b) to take action to limit, suspend or
terminate the authority of any school, lender or other institution to
participate in the FFEL Program as administered by the corporation for
violation of any applicable Federal or New York State law, rule, regulation or
policy pertaining to the FFEL Program; and
(c) to take such other steps as are
authorized by Federal or New York State law, rule, regulation or policy
pertaining to the FFEL Program that the corporation deems necessary or
appropriate to administer the FFEL Program in New York State. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2101.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
